title: Chinese Government donates 200,000 Sinopharm COVID-19 doses worth $3.6 million in December 2021
description: On December 1, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 200,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of The Gambia.  China’s Ambassador to The Gambia, Ma Jianchun, and Gambia Foreign Affairs Minister, Hon. Mamadou Tangara, went to Banjul International Airport to receive the vaccines and attend the handover ceremony.
staff_comments: According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the December 2021 donation as $3.6 million
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates 200,000 Sinopharm COVID-19 doses worth $3.6 million in December 2021

# Description
On December 1, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 200,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of The Gambia.  China’s Ambassador to The Gambia, Ma Jianchun, and Gambia Foreign Affairs Minister, Hon. Mamadou Tangara, went to Banjul International Airport to receive the vaccines and attend the handover ceremony.
justification: Project is a healthcare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of COVID-19 vaccines, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Embassy provides two vehicles to Gambia’s National Assembly in July 2021
description: On July 29, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Gambia donated two motor vehicles to the Gambia National Assembly. The purpose of this donation is to address the assembly’s mobility challenges and improve their transportation operations. The specific vehicles provided and the monetary value of this donation are unspecified.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ma Jianchun, China’s Ambassador to Gambia, attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides two vehicles to Gambia’s National Assembly in July 2021

# Description
On July 29, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Gambia donated two motor vehicles to the Gambia National Assembly. The purpose of this donation is to address the assembly’s mobility challenges and improve their transportation operations. The specific vehicles provided and the monetary value of this donation are unspecified.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ma Jianchun, China’s Ambassador to Gambia, attended the ceremony.
justification: Project involves donation of vehicles for government operations without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of two motor vehicles to Gambia's National Assembly for transportation operations

title: Chinese Government provides USD 78,750 for health support via United Nations Population Fund in Gambia in April 2021
description: In April 2021, Chinese government donates USD 78,750 to provide health assistance to Sao Tome and Principe and Gambia in West and Central Africa Region for COVID-19 pandemic response.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides USD 78,750 for health support via United Nations Population Fund in Gambia in April 2021

In April 2021, Chinese government donates USD 78,750 to provide health assistance to Sao Tome and Principe and Gambia in West and Central Africa Region for COVID-19 pandemic response.
justification: Project is focused on health assistance and pandemic response, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Health assistance for COVID-19 pandemic response, funding through United Nations Population Fund

title: Bank of China contributes to $1.5 billion syndicated receivables-backed trade finance facility to COCOBOD for its 2021/2022 crop season financing needs (Linked to Project ID#92598)
description: On September 21, 2021, a consortium of 28 financial institutions — including the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and Bank of China (BOC) — finalized a $1.5 billion receivables-backed trade finance facility (loan) agreement with Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD), a state-owned enterprise and the world's second-largest cocoa producer, for purchasing cocoa from farmers during the 2021/2022 crop season. The amount is expected to be used to purchase some 950,000 tonnes of cocoa for the period.  The 28 participants in the loan syndicate included Bank of China (Project ID#92597), Standard Charted Bank, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (Project ID#92598), Coöperatieve Rabobank, MUFG Bank Ltd, Natixis, Nedbank Ltd, Ghana international Bank, EcoBank Ghana Limited, Standard Chartered Bank, Société General Ghana Limited and Absa Ghana Limited.   The borrowing terms included a 7-month repayment period, an interest rate of LIBOR plus 110 basis points, a commitment fee of 0.62%, and an upfront fee of 1.25%. The loan was expected to be repaid in seven equal installments between February to August 2022. The Government of Ghana issued a sovereign guarantee in support of the loan. The loan was also secured by (i.e. collateralized against) receivables from future cocoa sales contracts.
staff_comments: 1. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate by adding 1.1% to the average 6-month LIBOR rate in September 2021 (0.197%). 2. The individual contributions of the banks that participated in the lending syndicate are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions ($53,571,428) across all 28 members of the syndicate, which implies that the total financial commitment from Chinese state-owned banks was $107,142,856. 3. Ghana’s cocoa production is regulated by the Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD), an organization separate from the Ministry of Food and Agriculture that is wholly owned by the Government of Ghana. COCOBOD does not purchase any of the cocoa which is exported, but is responsible for assuring the quality of the product. To ensure the high quality of Ghana’s cocoa exports, the COCOBOD oversees horticulture practices and regulates the use of pesticides and fertilizer. In addition, COCOBOD sets the producer prices for cocoa farmers and, through a subsidiary, oversees the marketing of cocoa. The operations of the COCOBOD are funded through the receipt of a percentage of the revenue received from cocoa exports, but all profits after covering expenses are passed onto the Government of Ghana in the form of export taxes. 4. In August 2017, COCOBOD told the country’s parliament it was in financial distress due to obligations that included servicing China Eximbank loans for the Bui Dam Construction Project (captured via Project ID#183, ID#30801, ID#30709, and ID#30086). 5. AidData has assumed that the 1.25% flat (upfront) fee is functionally equivalent to a management fee.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Bank of China contributes to $1.5 billion syndicated receivables-backed trade finance facility to COCOBOD for its 2021/2022 crop season financing needs (Linked to Project ID#92598)

# Description
On September 21, 2021, a consortium of 28 financial institutions — including the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and Bank of China (BOC) — finalized a $1.5 billion receivables-backed trade finance facility (loan) agreement with Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD), a state-owned enterprise and the world's second-largest cocoa producer, for purchasing cocoa from farmers during the 2021/2022 crop season. The amount is expected to be used to purchase some 950,000 tonnes of cocoa for the period.  The 28 participants in the loan syndicate included Bank of China (Project ID#92597), Standard Charted Bank, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (Project ID#92598), Coöperatieve Rabobank, MUFG Bank Ltd, Natixis, Nedbank Ltd, Ghana international Bank, EcoBank Ghana Limited, Standard Chartered Bank, Société General Ghana Limited and Absa Ghana Limited.   The borrowing terms included a 7-month repayment period, an interest rate of LIBOR plus 110 basis points, a commitment fee of 0.62%, and an upfront fee of 1.25%. The loan was expected to be repaid in seven equal installments between February to August 2022. The Government of Ghana issued a sovereign guarantee in support of the loan. The loan was also secured by (i.e. collateralized against) receivables from future cocoa sales contracts.
justification: Project involves financial services for agricultural trade without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Receivables-backed trade finance facility for cocoa purchasing, no direct environmental or energy-related components

ICBC contributes to $1.5 billion syndicated receivables-backed trade finance facility to COCOBOD for its 2021/2022 crop season financing needs (Linked to Project ID#92597)

title: China South-South Cooperation Fund donates $1,000,000 USD to UNICEF for COVID-19 relief
description: On February 26, 2021, China donated $1 million USD from the South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund to a UNICEF program that will help Ghana respond the COVID-19 pandemic. This money will be used to help the government of Ghana improve newborn care and child health, prevent, detect and treat severe acute malnutrition. The COVID-19 pandemic had worsened already tenuous conditions for child mortality, with the MICS (Multiple Indicators Cluster Survey) estimating between 27 and 56 deaths per 1000 live births respectively.  Through this grant, UNICEF will continue supporting the Government of Ghana with the provision of nutrition supplies such as iron-folic tablets, vitamin A supplements, weighing scales and height boards, ready-to-use therapeutic foods, therapeutic milk and essential medicine and neonatal intensive care equipment to help newborns survive and thrive.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China South-South Cooperation Fund donates $1,000,000 USD to UNICEF for COVID-19 relief

# Description
On February 26, 2021, China donated $1 million USD from the South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund to a UNICEF program that will help Ghana respond the COVID-19 pandemic. This money will be used to help the government of Ghana improve newborn care and child health, prevent, detect and treat severe acute malnutrition. The COVID-19 pandemic had worsened already tenuous conditions for child mortality, with the MICS (Multiple Indicators Cluster Survey) estimating between 27 and 56 deaths per 1000 live births respectively.  Through this grant, UNICEF will continue supporting the Government of Ghana with the provision of nutrition supplies such as iron-folic tablets, vitamin A supplements, weighing scales and height boards, ready-to-use therapeutic foods, therapeutic milk and essential medicine and neonatal intensive care equipment to help newborns survive and thrive.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare and child welfare without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Funding for COVID-19 relief, newborn care, child health, and nutrition supplies

title: 10th Chinese Medical Team to Ghana provides Traditional Chinese Medicine supplies to the China Traditional Herbal Hospital
description: On July 20, 2021, the 10th Chinese medical team to Ghana donated 70 boxes of acupuncture needles, moxibustion tools, acupuncture charts, and other medical supplies to the China Traditional Herbal Hospital. This donation was made in order to encourage the practice of Traditional Chinese Medicine, or TCM.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
10th Chinese Medical Team to Ghana provides Traditional Chinese Medicine supplies to the China Traditional Herbal Hospital

# Description
On July 20, 2021, the 10th Chinese medical team to Ghana donated 70 boxes of acupuncture needles, moxibustion tools, acupuncture charts, and other medical supplies to the China Traditional Herbal Hospital. This donation was made in order to encourage the practice of Traditional Chinese Medicine, or TCM.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare support and medical supplies donation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of Traditional Chinese Medicine supplies to hospital, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates digital equipment worth ¢50,000 Ghanaian Cedi to Ghana News Agency
description: On October 6, 2021, Ghana News Agency (GNA) reported that the Chinese Embassy in Ghana, which is located in Accra, donated 10 HP Desktop Computers, 10 Avita laptops, 10 Huawei Mate pads, and 10 Huawei Nova 7i phones to the GNA worth ¢50,000 Ghanaian Cedi.  The General Manager of the Ghana News Agency, Mr. Albert Kofi Owusu, on behalf of the Board and Management, thanked the Embassy for the donation and said the equipment would go to support the news agency’s digitization drive.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates digital equipment worth ¢50,000 Ghanaian Cedi to Ghana News Agency

# Description
On October 6, 2021, Ghana News Agency (GNA) reported that the Chinese Embassy in Ghana, which is located in Accra, donated 10 HP Desktop Computers, 10 Avita laptops, 10 Huawei Mate pads, and 10 Huawei Nova 7i phones to the GNA worth ¢50,000 Ghanaian Cedi.  The General Manager of the Ghana News Agency, Mr. Albert Kofi Owusu, on behalf of the Board and Management, thanked the Embassy for the donation and said the equipment would go to support the news agency’s digitization drive.
justification: Donation of digital equipment to support news agency operations, no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of computers, laptops, tablets, and phones to support digitization of news agency

title: The Chinese Embassy in Grenada provides 60,000 XCD of daily necessities to Social Welfare Institutions in Grenada in December 2021
description: The Chinese Embassy in Grenada reports that on the 14th and 21st of December 2021, Chinese Ambassador Wei Hongtian visited a variety of social welfare institutions in Grenada. The embassy donated 60,000 XCD of "refrigerators, blenders, microwave ovens, toilet papers... sanitizers," and other materials to the institutions, which included the Grand Anse Home for the Aged, Dorothy Hopkin Home for the Disabled, Richmond Hill Home for the Elderly and Father Mallaghan’s Home for Boys. The exact distribution of materials and XCD to each recipient is unknown.
staff_comments: 1. The exact distribution of materials and XCD to each recipient is unknown. No sources describe the distribution so separate projects were not created to document the donation.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
The Chinese Embassy in Grenada provides 60,000 XCD of daily necessities to Social Welfare Institutions in Grenada in December 2021

# Description
The Chinese Embassy in Grenada reports that on the 14th and 21st of December 2021, Chinese Ambassador Wei Hongtian visited a variety of social welfare institutions in Grenada. The embassy donated 60,000 XCD of "refrigerators, blenders, microwave ovens, toilet papers... sanitizers," and other materials to the institutions, which included the Grand Anse Home for the Aged, Dorothy Hopkin Home for the Disabled, Richmond Hill Home for the Elderly and Father Mallaghan’s Home for Boys. The exact distribution of materials and XCD to each recipient is unknown.
justification: Project involves donation of basic necessities to social welfare institutions with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of refrigerators, blenders, microwave ovens, and other daily necessities to elderly homes and disabled care facilities

title: Chinese Embassy in Grenada provides 48,000 XCD to lighting the Hillsborough Playing Field in Carriacou in November 2021
description: On November 12, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Grenada donated 48,000 XCD to the Ministry of Carriacou and Petite Martinique Affairs in Grenada. This grant will be used to light the Hillsborough Playing Field in Carriacou. The donation covers a third of the total cost of the lighting project.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Grenada provides 48,000 XCD to lighting the Hillsborough Playing Field in Carriacou in November 2021

# Description
On November 12, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Grenada donated 48,000 XCD to the Ministry of Carriacou and Petite Martinique Affairs in Grenada. This grant will be used to light the Hillsborough Playing Field in Carriacou. The donation covers a third of the total cost of the lighting project.
justification: Project focuses on community infrastructure improvement without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Lighting installation for playing field, social development focus
